Subjective: Red, irritated right eye since Tuesday; feels like foreign body; worse on right > left; no vision changes, pain, or discharge; no fever, headache, or URI symptoms; no contact lens use; no new cosmetics; concerned about contagion; requests advice on treatment (antibiotics/eye drops); managing well with daughter and work.
Objective: Vitals: not reported; PE: right eye red, thickened conjunctiva; left eye mild redness; no foreign body, discharge, or vision changes; pupils reactive; normal exam otherwise.
Assessment: Viral conjunctivitis; no bacterial signs; no corneal abrasion.
Plan: Artificial tears as needed; warm compresses; avoid rubbing; follow-up in 2 weeks or sooner if worse; no antibiotics needed unless bacterial signs arise.
